page.title: 01Cranshaws, Whiteadder Valley
page.content: The block lies in the Lammermuir Hills and is a hill farming area. It is the Upper Valley of the River Whiteadder (pronounced Whitadder). The land is mainly rough grazing and woodland - the arable land lying close to the river. Population is 64 - 40 adults, 24 children (9 high school, 9 primary, 6 pre-school). 18 adults are in paid employment (4 are full-time, 4 part time agricultural workers). The river is restocked with trout each spring. Fishing is allowed only on purchase of a permit. The nearest shops are in Duns - 10 miles to the South. A mobile butcher's van visits twice per week. It delivers ordered bread and milk. A milkman delivers milk, cream and eggs three times weekly. The mail van comes each day except Sunday and delivers newspapers. A mobile library visits once each fortnight.
